column4: open a terminal kill the process doing the upgrade and redo the upgrade from the console
and use aptitude instaed of apt-get, it deals better with dependecies
sudo ps aux
it's important that you continue the upgrade without rebooting to bring your system into a stable configuration
unfortunately the system is quite slow due to the current upgrade process, and I'm having quite a time getting to the terminal
Press Crtl+Alt+F1 to get to the console
Wait a bit it should show up
can you reach your pc through ssh?
I do not know. How might I go about that?
you need another pc in the same network and try to connect with ssh
I don't think I'm going to be able to set that up right now
ssh that is
still no passwd prompt?
nope
btw the computer is free from any documents I might want preserved.
so I can do possibly destructive things.
Strange, do Strg+Alt+F2 and try again to login, don't use root as login as it doesn't have a password set
Ctrl
On german keyborad it's called Strg :)
surprisingly responsive, but still no password prompt
and there is no delay when typing
Your system seems really broken then
well the update is still going behind the scenes
I thinl
Okay hit Ctrl+Alt+F7 to get back to your graphic session
ok so now I have nothing, just a black screen
and now a mouse
and now the graphical display
ok I'm back
if you can't login on the console, I have no idea how to get your system back working, sorry
what does it mean when an individual window dims?
well this is interesting.
I forced it to power down, thinking it would destroy it, but it booted fine.
Perfect, lucky man
yup
so how might I go about updating distros from the command line?
I prefer doing it on the console, do as you want
sudo aptitude dist-upgrade
thanks!
this is even more interesting. Under about ubuntu it tells me i'm using 11.04 natty narwhall
So you didn't upgrade to maverick but to 11.04

at least the about ubuntu dialogue did
